snippet: A woman who spent nearly four years in prison for the courtroom killing of a man accused of molesting her son  may soon be released.    The California Supreme Court recently granted the woman, Ellie Nesler, a partial retrial, citing juror miscondu...
lead_paragraph: A woman who spent nearly four years in prison for the courtroom killing of a man accused of molesting her son may soon be released. The California Supreme Court recently granted the woman, Ellie Nesler, a partial retrial, citing juror misconduct, and The Modesto Bee reported today that Ms. Nesler, 45, was expected to withdraw her plea of not guilty by reason of insanity and enter a guilty plea to manslaughter charges. That would mean a seven-year prison term and make her immediately eligible for parole because she had already served more than half the reduced time.
abstract: Ellie Nesler, California woman who spent nearly four years in prison for courtroom killing of Daniel Driver, man accused of molesting her son, may soon be released (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Woman May Be Freed In Courtroom Killing
